comments:
Build ID:  I20061212-0010

Steps To Reproduce:
With the expressions view open and visible, create a new watchpoint (from the editor for example).  A new tree item is added to the expressions view, but its label and icon are empty.  An error is added to the log as follows:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2006-12-12 13:46:01.859
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "children update".
!STACK 0
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.model.ChildrenUpdate.setChild(ChildrenUpdate.java:94)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.elements.ElementContentProvider.retrieveChildren(ElementContentProvider.java:88)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.elements.ElementContentProvider$1.run(ElementContentProvider.java:40)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

If a different view is selected that displays on top of the expressions view (such as the Variables View) and then the expressions view is selected again, the icon and label are filled in.  However another error is added to the log as follows:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2006-12-12 14:04:36.718
!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.NullPointerException)

I am using the 1.4.2 Sun jdk.

More information:
Fixed in ExpressionManagerContentProvider. We were not returning a subset of elements from the content provider as specified - instead we were returning all elements.

bug in comment#4 is a dup of bug 173896. Marking fixed & verified for original problem (that was already fixed/verified).
